page.title: 06ENERGY USE IN KILTARLITY
page.content: Electricity is the main energy source for domestic needs.All the power supply cables are overhead,as in most areas served by the North of Scotland Hydro-Electricity Board.The scattered nature of the housing would make underground power cables too expensive.Only a few of the most remote houses do not have mains electricity and depend on diesel generators.In the school's survey of 51 houses,25% used a second energy source such as paraffin or bottled gas (there is no mains gas in the area). 40% of houses surveyed used wood as well as coal for heating,with coal being the single most popular domestic fuel. The few industrial users in the area e.g. the sawmill and builders yards depend on electricity,most of which comes from nearby Kilmorack Hydro-electric power station.
